activeSupply(uint256,uint256).details: Returns the active supply of the bond in question.

approve(address,(uint256,uint256,uint256.details: Allows _spender to withdraw from your account multiple times, up to the _amount.

params._spender: is the address the caller approve for his bonds

balanceOf(address,uint256,uint256).details: Returns the balance of the giving bond classId and bond nonce.

burn(address,(uint256,uint256,uint256)[].details: allows the transfer of any number of bond types from an address to another. The calling of this function needs to be restricted to bond issuer contract.

params._from: argument is the address of the holder whose balance about to decrees.

burnedSupply(uint256,uint256).details: Returns the burned supply of the bond in question.

classMetadata(uint256).details: Returns the JSON metadata of the classes. The metadata SHOULD follow a set of structure explained later in eip-3475.md

classValues(uint256,uint256).details: Returns the values of given classId. the metadata SHOULD follow a set of structure explained in eip-3475.md

getProgress(uint256,uint256).details: Returns the informations about the progress needed to redeem the bond

issue(address,(uint256,uint256,uint256)[.details: allows issuing of any number of bond types to an address. The calling of this function needs to be restricted to bond issuer contract.

params._to: is the address to which the bond will be issued.

nonceMetadata(uint256,uint256).details: Returns the JSON metadata of the nonces. The metadata SHOULD follow a set of structure explained later in eip-3475.md

nonceValues(uint256,uint256,uint256).details: Returns the values of given nonceId. The metadata SHOULD follow a set of structure explained in eip-3475.md

redeem(address,(uint256,uint256,uint256).details: allows redemption of any number of bond types from an address. The calling of this function needs to be restricted to bond issuer contract.

params._from: is the address _from which the bond will be redeemed.

redeemedSupply(uint256,uint256).details: Returns the redeemed supply of the bond in question.

setApprovalFor(address,bool).details: MUST emit the ApprovalForAll event on success.

params._approved: "True" if the operator is approved, "False" to revoke approval
params._operator: Address to add to the set of authorized operators

totalSupply(uint256,uint256).details: Returns the total supply of the bond in question.

transferAllowanceFrom(address,address,(u.details: allows the transfer of allowance from an address to another (either single or in batches).

params._from: argument is the address of the holder whose balance about to decrease.
params._to: argument is the address of the recipient whose balance is about to increased.

transferFrom(address,address,(uint256,ui.details: allows the transfer of a bond from an address to another (either single or in batches).

params._from: argument is the address of the holder whose balance about to decrease.
params._to: argument is the address of the recipient whose balance is about to increased.

Burn(address,address,(uint256,uint256,ui.notice: MUST trigger when tokens are burned

Issue(address,address,(uint256,uint256,u.notice: MUST trigger when tokens are issued

Redeem(address,address,(uint256,uint256,.notice: MUST trigger when tokens are redeemed

Transfer(address,address,address,(uint25.notice: MUST trigger when tokens are transferred, including zero value transfers.

allowance(address,address,uint256,uint25.notice: Returns the _amount which spender is still allowed to withdraw from _owner.

approve(address,(uint256,uint256,uint256.notice: If this function is called again it overwrites the current allowance with _amount.

getProgress(uint256,uint256).notice: Every bond contract can have their own logic concerning the progress definition.

isApprovedFor(address,address).notice: Queries the approval status of an operator for a given owner. Returns "True" if the operator is approved, "False" if not

setApprovalFor(address,bool).notice: Enable or disable approval for a third party ("operator") to manage all of the caller's tokens.
